page.title: 01DIDMARTON AND SOPWORTH
page.content: On dip slope of Cotswolds; Limestone (Forest Marble) with shallow loamy top soil. Still mostly farming - milking herds (Friesians) store cattle, barley, some wheat, a little horse breeding. Poor quality woodland on Badminton Estate. Most farmers tenants of Badminton. Area dotted with small brakes for foxes; hunting country. Headwaters of Bristol Avon. One large (Didmarton) on small (Sopwort village. All older buildings of Cotswold stone, mostly with stone roofs. A little recent development at Didmarton. 2 new houses at Sopworth. A few isolated groups of buildings, mostly estate of farming. Some magnificient stone farm buildings, great cruciform barns, etc. Stone field walls, few hedges, walls much in need of repair and deteriorating. Very small proportion of population engaged in farming now.
